channel.title: strings :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: strings Instances of the string class are immutable sequences of characters. Because string is a class, it is a reference type. Because instances are immutable, once they are constructed, their contents cannot change. Note that this does not mean that string variables cannot change - we can assign a string variable s the value “abc” and later assign it the value “xyz”. These assignments simply assign to s references to different instances of the string class.
